  16. ‌type extern_flags =
  17.     No_sharing
  18.   | Closures
  19.   | Compat_32
  20.   | Compression
  21. (* note: this type definition is used in 'runtime/debugger.c' *)

  23. external to_channel: out_channel -> 'a -> extern_flags list -> unit
  24.     = "caml_output_value"
  25. external to_bytes: 'a -> extern_flags list -> bytes
  26.     = "caml_output_value_to_bytes"
  27. external to_string: 'a -> extern_flags list -> string
  28.     = "caml_output_value_to_string"
  29. external to_buffer_unsafe:
  30.       bytes -> int -> int -> 'a -> extern_flags list -> int
  31.     = "caml_output_value_to_buffer"

  33. ‌let to_buffer buff ofs len v flags =
  34.   if ofs < 0 || len < 0 || ofs > Bytes.length buff - len
  35.   then invalid_arg "Marshal.to_buffer: substring out of bounds"
  36.   else to_buffer_unsafe buff ofs len v flags

  38. (* The functions below use byte sequences as input, never using any
  39.    mutation. It makes sense to use non-mutated [bytes] rather than
  40.    [string], because we really work with sequences of bytes, not
  41.    a text representation.
  42. *)

  44. external from_channel: in_channel -> 'a = "caml_input_value"
  45. external from_bytes_unsafe: bytes -> int -> 'a = "caml_input_value_from_bytes"
  46. external data_size_unsafe: bytes -> int -> int = "caml_marshal_data_size"

  48. ‌let header_size = 16
  49. ‌let data_size buff ofs =
  50.   if ofs < 0 || ofs > Bytes.length buff - header_size
  51.   then invalid_arg "Marshal.data_size"
  52.   else data_size_unsafe buff ofs
  53. ‌let total_size buff ofs = header_size + data_size buff ofs

  55. ‌let from_bytes buff ofs =
  56.   if ofs < 0 || ofs > Bytes.length buff - header_size
  57.   then invalid_arg "Marshal.from_bytes"
  58.   else begin
  59.     let len = data_size_unsafe buff ofs in
  60.     if ofs > Bytes.length buff - (header_size + len)
  61.     then invalid_arg "Marshal.from_bytes"
  62.     else from_bytes_unsafe buff ofs
  63.   end

  65. ‌let from_string buff ofs =
  66.   (* Bytes.unsafe_of_string is safe here, as the produced byte
  67.      sequence is never mutated *)
  68.   from_bytes (Bytes.unsafe_of_string buff) ofs

  70. ‌let compression_supported () =
  71.   let s = to_string () [Compression] in
  72.   match s.[3] with
  73.   | '\xBD' -> true
  74.   | '\xBE' -> false
  75.   | _ -> assert false
